Discussions.Discussion_Name: Supplement on definition of associates primes

Messages.Author: Peter Bürgisser
Messages.Content: I uploaded a document showing that the definition of associates primes given in the lecture is equivalent to one usually given in the literature.

Messages.Author: Peter Bürgisser
Messages.Content: In the lecture today, I mentioned that for polynomial rings over fields, the existence of the primary decomposition was shown by Steinitz, a chess world champion. However, I confused Steinitz with Emanuel Lasker, who also was a chess world champion. In fact, I confused Wilhelm Steinitz (the chess champion) with Ernst Steinitz, a mathematician who made important contributions to abstract algebra.  Emmy Noether generalized Lasker's theorem to any noetherian rings.

Messages.Author: Peter Bürgisser
Messages.Content: We will have a first round of oral exams in late August 2024. A second round is planned for the second week of October. First round: August 26 - 27. Please send me an email to      pbuerg@math.tu-berlin.de with your name and matrikel number if you want to take the exam. I will then prepare a schedule and make it available via ISIS.

Messages.Author: Peter Bürgisser
Messages.Content: Please fill out the online evaluation for Algebra II (lecture=  https://befragung.tu-berlin.de/evasys/online.php?pswd=CKFJS This should be done until June 29. Thank you!

Messages.Author: Dominic Oliver Brooks Bunnett
Messages.Content: Dear Students, If you attended the Übung session and have time, please can you fill out the evaluation form for the Übung: https://befragung.tu-berlin.de/evasys/online.php?pswd=RW3ZR Thanks, Dominic

Messages.Author: Dominic Oliver Brooks Bunnett
Messages.Content: Dear Students, I have uploaded notes on the topic of today's Übung to the website. In particular, the categorical content is in an appendix at the end. I will add a few more counterexamples of interest over the coming week. Thanks, Dominic
